author: samcm
content:

author: realbigsean
content: <@898563924440543283> You might be interested in this discussion? It's a proposal to switch back to hash tee root for blob tx hash so that it's forward compatible with a future where all tx types are SSZ encoded https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6385

content:

 <skylenet> [reply]: I've created this endpoint that spits out some infos for all clients that we're running, including the peer_id: https://bootnode-1.server.48...```
 I'm getting an SSL error (handshake failure) on this endpoint... was working fine last week.

author: skylenet
content: henridf: https://bootnode-1.srv.4844-devnet-4.ethpandaops.io/meta/api/v1/inventory.json We had to change the dns names a bit.

author: roberto.bayardo
content: Yes aware of it, though I don't believe it sufficiently addresses forward compatibility like, say, https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-6404-ssz-transactions-root/12783 which is being discussing in <#779922457631916064>

author: roberto.bayardo
content: My preference is we either leave the hashes as-is for the next hard fork (keeping SSZ merkelization out of the EL entirely), or we address it through one of these more complete SSZ migrations.
